security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. This skill contains only markdown documentation templates with placeholder syntax ({{VARIABLE}}). The scanner misidentified template placeholders like {{CODE_SAMPLE}} as shell backticks, and words like 'description' as crypto/C2 keywords. No executable code, network access, or dangerous capabilities exist.

content.user_title: Conduct Structured Technical Spikes and Research
content.value_statement: Technical decisions made without proper investigation lead to costly rework and technical debt. This skill provides structured templates for timeboxed spikes with clear comparison matrices and recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Structures timeboxed technical investigations with clear objectives and success criteria
Creates comparison matrices for evaluating multiple technical options
Documents proof of concept implementations with pros and cons
Identifies risks, dependencies, and mitigation strategies
Provides phased implementation roadmaps with effort estimates
Tracks open questions and unanswered items systematically
limitations: Does not execute code or run automated tests
Does not fetch external documentation or APIs
Does not perform actual performance benchmarking
Requires manual effort to implement suggested POC code

use_cases.title: Evaluate Architecture Patterns
use_cases.description: Compare microservices, event-driven, and monolith approaches with structured POC code samples and weighted criteria matrices.

use_cases.title: Assess Technology Feasibility
use_cases.description: Determine viability of new frameworks or tools within defined time and resource constraints before committing.

use_cases.title: Investigate Implementation Options
use_cases.description: Explore solutions for complex features with documented trade-offs, risks, and clear justified recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate New Framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Technical Research skill to evaluate [FRAMEWORK] for [USE_CASE]. Timebox: 4 hours. Answer: 1) Learning curve? 2) Performance impact? 3) Maintenance burden?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct technical spike on [TOPIC]. Explore 3 options with POC code. Use criteria: performance, maintainability, team familiarity. Provide recommendation.

prompt_templates.title: Library Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare [LIBRARY_A] vs [LIBRARY_B] for [USE_CASE]. Create comparison matrix with: community support, documentation, bundle size, performance.

prompt_templates.title: Feasibility Study
prompt_templates.prompt: Investigate feasibility of [FEATURE]. Constraints: [CONSTRAINTS]. Document risks, dependencies, and provide implementation path if viable.

output_examples.input: Evaluate Next.js vs Remix for our e-commerce platform with SSR requirement
output: Objective: Determine best React meta-framework for e-commerce SSR
Three options explored with POC code for product listing page
Comparison matrix scoring: Next.js 42, Remix 38, SolidStart 28
Recommendation: Next.js for better ecosystem and team familiarity
Risks: App router learning curve, mitigation via incremental adoption

output_examples.input: Spike on caching strategy for high-traffic API
output: Options: Redis cluster, CDN edge caching, application-level cache
POC code demonstrating each approach with benchmark setup
Weighted matrix on latency, cost, complexity, and scalability
Recommendation: Redis cluster with CDN for static assets
Implementation phases: 1) Redis setup 2) Cache invalidation 3) CDN layer

best_practices: Define clear success criteria and questions before starting investigation
Stay within timebox and document what was not explored
Create runnable POC code rather than theoretical analysis only
anti_patterns: Starting spike without clear objectives or measurable criteria
Exploring only one option instead of comparing alternatives
Skipping risk assessment and implementation path sections

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The structured templates guide any LLM through technical investigations.

faq.question: How long should a technical spike take?
faq.answer: Most spikes should be 2-8 hours. Longer investigations should be split into multiple focused spikes.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution or network access. Your data stays in your conversation.

faq.question: Can I adapt this for non-technical research?
faq.answer: Yes. The comparison matrix and structured approach work for any decision requiring multiple options analysis.

faq.question: What if my spike exceeds the timebox?
faq.answer: Document findings so far, list unanswered questions, and recommend a follow-up spike. Partial results are valuable.

faq.question: Do I need to write all the POC code myself?
faq.answer: The AI can generate POC code samples. You may need to test and refine them in your actual environment.
